First Time User Acquisition

Audit your website

  If Don't have a website yet look at How To Start A blog (And Make Money) in 2019

ID: The best way to drive scaleable and consistent traffic and customers to your website is through SEO. Instead of just doing things
post_author: take a strategic approach instead and audit your website to create a game plan so that you can focus on the highest leverage opportunities.

ID: Do this using a combination of a site crawler and a digital marketing tool like SEMrush to both proactively discover current opportunities/issues and to proactively learn about new challenges and opportunities as you go about building your business.

Look at where you can add new category pages
post_content: new blog posts
post_title: or new pieces of attractive content (visuals

ID: Because you are tracking your keyword rankings (you are
post_author: right? If you’re not
post_date: use SEMrush)
post_date_gmt: you can find the keywords that you rank near the bottom of the first page and go add useful content to those pages to help them rank better. Google also prefers updated and new content over old stale content.

ID: A great way to attract new users to your company or website is to launch products that meet their needs. The great part is that you can often charge for these as well and make money will getting new users into your full conversion funnel.

The great thing about the Internet is that you can publish any type of content you want. By creating longer form content like courses that are targeted around both user needs and specific keyword phrases
post_author: you can drive more traffic to your site and convert them into email addresses that you can then take down your funnel.
online course websites exist in plenty so you can put them on places like Lynda.com to further your reach.

ID: By using a site like Similar Web
post_author: you can find sites related to yours. If they have your audience
post_date: you can usually get content onto their site that helps them build traffic while at the same time getting access to their new audience.

post_author: many sites want links for SEO purposes and access to your customers. If they’re not a direct competitor
post_date: let them guest post on your site! Then they are invested in your company and will promote the content that they’ve produced
post_date_gmt: which also gets you in front of their own audience. Double win!

ID: If you have a designer in your company or can find one online
post_author: create useful graphics that tell a story and help people see your content in a new way. Do outreach for links
post_date: promote on Pinterest

post_author: and one of the best ways to grow a podcast audience is to invite influential people onto your podcast. Think about it like audio version guest posts. So
post_date: get one or two podcasts under your belt (or launch your own) then start targeting podcast producers to get onto their shows.

post_author: Twitter
post_date: and other networkds is still relatively cheap today as compared to Adwords. Many of them also allow you to segment down by demographics or target by keywords so that you hit your ideal audience.

ID: PPC is usually best used for conversion-oriented keywords
post_author: which is great because it gets you a new audience that is also ready to convert.

ID: What better way to show your expertise and get people reading all of your content than to teach what you already know? If you have a craft
post_author: create a course to teach it then sell it on places like Udemy while simultaneously selling it on your site from a page targeted towards a high volume keyword for SEO.

ID: Pinterest is a super strong domain and your Pinterest boards can rank very well. Do your typical keyword research for your website
post_author: then take some of those keywords and target them on Pinterest. A pro tip is to use your other online resources (website
post_date: Instagram
post_date_gmt: etc) to get them indexed faster and ranking better.

post_author: it’s not just enough to create content and expect it to rank and drive traffic. Rankings are influenced by engagement stronger than ever before
post_date: so use some budget to promote pins on Pinterest to your target audience.

post_author: partnerships can be gold for customer acquisition. Build out referral programs with complementary companies to yours and try to funnel some of their traffic back to your site
post_date: either through website mentions or even their email marketing.

ID: This feels like an old school tactic
post_author: but it’s still true that the more links you have to your site
post_date: the better your site will rank. So acquire links to your site from content
post_date_gmt: from relevant resource pages on other sites
post_content: and from outreach that you do.

ID: Content promotion is so cheap these days that you’d be silly not to do it. I know people with content sites making literally thousands of dollars a day all from promoted content.
If your main website is around one niche yet you operate in many niches
post_author: you can build out websites specifically targeted at those other niches and use them to funnel traffic to your other sites. You need to disclose that you own those other sites
post_date: but this is a great way to spread the organic reach.

ID: A fast site not only converts better
post_author: but on a big site you will also get more organic traffic because the search engines are able to crawl your site faster and find more content. Start with switching hosts then optimizing your code
post_date: all while making sure you are using aggressive caching and a content delivery network (CDN).

ID: If you’re really struggling to increase traffic to your site
post_author: go do new keyword research to get new content ideas
post_date: then go back to point 1 above and create new content!

ID: Target the longtail of keywords for SEO
If you don’t have a very strong website
post_author: you can target longer tail keywords (<50 searches a month) which are often much easier to rank for. From this you can start building up a base of content that you can then use to earn links and propel rankings for more competitive terms.

ID: If you can get content or a product to go hot on a site like Hacker News
post_author: Reddit
post_date: or ProductHunt you can literally get tens of thousands of visitors and often signups and sales. I (John) personally make over $70k from my site sitting on the first page of ProductHunt for a day
post_date_gmt: and I’ve seen Reddit drive tens of thousands of visits to sites.

ID: One of the best ways to build an email list and therefore a new audience is through giving away high value items and incentivizing your entrants to share as well in order to get more entries. I use the Kingsumo Giveaways plugin for this.

post_author: conferences can be a great way to get in front of a targeted audience. If you encourage them to tweet about it (put your Twitter handle on the bottom of every slide)
post_date: you also get in front of their social media audience.

ID: While speaking is the best way to get in front of your audience at conferences
post_author: advertising is second best. You can leverage advertising for brand recognition
post_date: offer discounts to those at the conference
post_date_gmt: get links from people doing roundups
post_content: and more. It’s a big win especially if you can tie revenue directly back to your company.

ID: I have constantly been amazed at how well quality swag works for advertising your brand
post_author: and what better place to give away swag than at conferences to your customers? You’ll build brand recognition and good will.

ID: Slideshare is its own content social network. By creating content for Slideshare specifically and promoting it
post_author: you can also land on the popular content sections of their homepage which drive great traffic. Make sure you link back to your site from Slideshare too.

ID: If you can create videos in a cost-effective manner
post_author: YouTube is a great distribution platform. It takes time to build the channel but has a huge audience if done well.
but there are videos on YouTube that your target audience watches? You can run YouTube videos.

ID: Webinars can drive a new audience for you when you invite guests
post_author: or do advertising
post_date: that have an audience that they will promote your webinar to. Try to bring on guests who already have a large audience.

ID: Help A Reporter Out is a great way to find great sources for stories you are writing. While this won’t directly get you a new audience
post_author: by including their quotes and tagging them on social media you can access their audience.

ID: Teach people how to do what you do
post_author: put your content on Slideshare
post_date: rinse

ID: Mentoring startups is a great way to build goodwill within your industry. Often you can also then get guest posts or leverage their name to get content elsewhere or to be quoted as an expert/source.
Meetup.com is one of the most popular websites online for organizing groups of people to get together. Many of them accept sponsors
post_author: who do things like give free meeting space or pay the bar tab. This can be a great way to get your company or product in front of your ideal target audience.

ID: Do outreach to get included in email newsletters

post_author: weekly
post_date: or monthly newsletters that curate content from around their industry
post_date_gmt: and many of these have a lot of subscribers. If you have content that fits their audience
post_content: reach out to them and see if they’ll include your article in their next edition.

ID: Starting a podcast is extremely popular these days
post_author: and for good reason – they can build a great audience
post_date: have a high barrier to entry to do well
post_date_gmt: and can set you apart as an expert in your space.

ID: If you write online at all
post_author: then you probably know Q&A platform Quora. Quora is a fantastic place to find questions people are asking around your area of expertise. Write a great answer
post_date: share it socially to get some upvotes
post_date_gmt: and watch your traffic (and referrals!) soar. At this time of writing
post_content: we receive about 10
post_title: 000 views a quarter on our answers and have received over 320

ID: Once you’ve attracted your customers to your site
post_author: whether to a piece of content via social or a conversion page via SEO
post_date: they’ll often leave your site and come back a few times before they actually convert. Sometimes they’re doing research

post_content: and sometimes they’re just not ready to buy or give you the information you so badly need from them to drive your business forward.

ID: Here are 9 ways to get people back to your site
Collect email addresses and send consistent emails

One of the simplest things to do that most people don’t actually do is send consistent email marketing to their customers who have given their email address. Whether this is a weekly newsletter or a daily piece of content to teach and sell
post_author: this is the best way to keep your users engaged. The best part is that once you set it up once

ID: If you’re not doing retargeting and you operate a business online
post_author: you are literally leaving money on the table. With all the different display networks available

post_author: find the sites similar to yours who are not competitors and see if you can advertise there. Now their audience is yours.

post_author: but your followers on social media (especially Facebook) don’t see all of the content you post. If you see a piece of content being successful and getting good exposure

post_author: like WordPress
post_date: will let people subscribe to replies to their comments that they leave on your content. You can also use a myriad of tools (like SumoMe) to capture email addresses to which you can send content when it publishes.

ID: If you’ve had someone sign up to your product
post_author: email them when something happens (a product goes out of stock or comes in stock
post_date: metrics change
post_date_gmt: etc) to get them back to engage with your product again.

ID: Email users who abandon their shopping cart
If you run an ecommerce site

ID: If you run a site that has products or things directly for sale
post_author: you could consider an affiliate program. While affiliate programs take management

Begin with outreach to sites that have written roundups of alternatives for your competitors and see if they’d like to include your site. Bonus points for getting them to add you at the top.

post_content: 51 Ways to drive traffic to your website in Kenya
post_title:
You need more website traffic. If you run an online business, traffic is your lifeblood because it enables your business model to work and pay your bills. Therefore, you need to employee multiple strategies to bring new visitors to your site and keep old visitors engaged with your content.

Here are 51 ways to drive and increase traffic to your website in 2019.

post_content: For first-time site builders and owners of small websites, shared hosting can fill the bill for an affordable price, but that option may not be able to meet the needs of larger, more complex sites and those with high traffic volume. For those users, dedicated hosting offers a scalable
post_title: highly customizable alternative that bypasses the limitations and risks of shared hosting in favor of sole occupancy on a server reserved exclusively for a single website.

post_author: account holders’ sites are hosted and maintained on the servers of a remote provider that is also responsible for essential maintenance and some site management
post_date: depending on the type of hosting plan. To keep costs low
post_date_gmt: shared hosting providers put many accounts on the same server
post_content: where they draw from the server’s shared resources.

post_author: any site can be affected by the behavior of its neighbors on the server. A surge in traffic on one site can cause others to run slowly or experience interruptions in service
post_date: and the basic security measures put in place by the provider may not be able to stop malicious activity that infects sites through shared technology. And
post_date_gmt: since shared hosting is designed for smaller sites with low traffic
post_content: when a site’s monthly traffic volume exceeds a cap set by the provider

ID: Dedicated hosting avoids those issues by providing a more flexible
post_author: efficient
post_date: and safe alternative for growing sites with an ever-increasing volume of traffic
post_date_gmt: as well as the established sites of large companies. In this hosting model
post_content: a provider makes an entire server and all its resources available to a single client
post_title: with varying levels of support and maintenance available depending on the provider’s hosting plans.

ID: Although dedicated web hosting can cost considerably more than basic shared hosting
post_author: this kind of hosting environment offers far more flexibility
post_date: privacy and user control than other kinds of web hosting solutions. The benefits of dedicated web hosting include enhanced performance
post_content: complete customer control
post_title: and a spectrum of support services from the hosting provider. If these are the kind of features you are looking for

post_author: all resources such as bandwidth
post_date: RAM and CPU output on a user’s contracted server are dedicated to supporting that user’s single site. That ensures maximum uptime with no “competition” from other sites on a shared server
post_date_gmt: so that a site’s performance can’t be affected by shifts in the use of those shared resources. With all resources available at all times
post_content: dedicated hosting can also offer enhanced speeds and added stability for businesses whose computing needs involve sensitive financial transactions or the handling of personal information.

ID: Dedicated website hosting avoids many of the security issues that worry users of shared hosting services. Depending on the hosting plan
post_author: dedicated hosting users may be able to install security measures designed to meet their specific needs alongside – or in place of – those that are provided by the host. Because sites on dedicated servers don’t share space with others
post_date: they face no risk of becoming “infected” through shared technology by malware or malicious activity directed at a neighboring site on a shared server.

ID: Each server used for hosting has its own IP address and
post_author: in a shared hosting environment
post_date: that IP address is also shared by all the sites
post_content: that are using that server. Because no other sites share a server in a dedicated hosting situation
post_title: each site has a unique IP address
post_excerpt: which eliminates confusion and adds additional layers of security that can be essential for processing financial and medical transactions.

ID: Dedicated hosting makes it possible for users to have virtually complete control over all aspects of their sites – or leave some or all of its management in the hands of the hosting provider. With managed hosting plans
post_author: the host handles ongoing site management along with maintaining the server itself
post_date: while self-managed hosting allows site owners complete control of all aspects of their site
post_date_gmt: with only server maintenance and support provided by the host. In both models
post_content: though
post_title: users are free to install software packages and security features of their choice to meet the specific needs of the site and the company behind it.

ID: Dedicated hosting also provides scalability for the life of a site. Though a site can outgrow the limited resources of a shared hosting environment fairly quickly
post_author: the resources of a dedicated server make it possible to scale a site to just about any size – and to add the additional features and functionality it needs at every stage of development. Dedicated hosting packages allow for scalability
post_date: too
post_date_gmt: with tiered pricing that reflects added RAM
post_content: bandwidth

ID: Dedicated hosting providers typically offer around the clock technical support from a well-trained staff with the expertise to resolve issues of all kinds – an important aspect of this kind of hosting
post_author: since users can opt to handle all aspects of site management on their own. Hosts also provide ongoing server support
post_date: including maintenance and installing upgrades and other features as needed for optimum performance and uptime. All costs for maintaining the server are assumed by the provider
post_date_gmt: but users can purchase and install any software they choose.

ID: Dedicated hosting is not for everyone. This kind of hosting can be expensive
post_author: costing hundreds per month
post_date: although some providers offer self-managed economy plans for less. For new users with small sites
post_date_gmt: or longtime sites with small amounts of traffic
post_content: shared hosting at a lower cost might be the right choice for both short and long term needs.

post_author: or expect to have
post_date: significant traffic
post_date_gmt: dedicated hosting provides the needed resources to accommodate site visits numbering into the millions. Dedicated hosting also supports complex sites that require extensive customization
post_content: such as those sponsored by large ecommerce businesses and other kinds of enterprises. This kind of hosting may also be right for sites that demand strict security
post_title: such as those involving financial transactions or the handling of medical data and patient information.

ID: Shared hosting options may be all a small site needs for the duration of its life
post_author: but with exclusive server resources and extensive user support
post_date: dedicated hosting provides the flexibility and scalability that can sustain a website’s growth and development now and for the future.

post_author: What is Dedicated Hosting?
post_content: closed
Over 90,000 hacking attacks per minute strike WordPress sites and WordPress hosting around the world
post_title: hitting not only large corporate websites packed with sensitive data
post_excerpt: but also sites belonging to small businesses
comment_status: and individuals running personal blogs. Security of WordPress sites typically tops the list of concerns for new and experienced website owners alike. For owners of WordPress sites
ping_status: statistics like that one raises particular worries about the security not just of individual WordPress sites
post_password: but of WordPress itself. No platform is ever completely safe from malware
to_ping: and other kinds of cyber attacks — but WordPress security includes protections on the source code itself
pinged: as well as precautions taken by both a hosting provider and site owners themselves.

ID: As you read this blog post
post_author: you may be wondering
post_date: “Is WordPress secure?” The number of cyber attacks striking WordPress websites of all kinds may seem extreme
post_date_gmt: suggesting that WordPress itself is inherently prone to dangerous security lapses. The fact that WordPress is a free and open source software package that anyone can not only download but also modify and share makes it appear especially vulnerable to any skilled hacker who can insert a snippet of malicious code into the WordPress core.

post_author: although WordPress is a product of developers and designers around the globe working to keep it updated and stable
post_date: security is the work of a team of dedicated developers who monitor WordPress for security vulnerabilities and install patches as soon as one becomes known. Between its launch in 2003 and early 2018
post_content: 500 security vulnerabilities have been patched. WordPress releases frequent updates to the software
post_excerpt: so it’s important for users to install updates whenever they become available.

ID: WordPress developers working to keep the platform as secure as possible are the first line of defense for your website
post_author: but they aren’t the only one. Both hosting providers and site owners have jobs to do in keeping up their WordPress site security.

quality website hosting providers also have protocols in place to protect WordPress and other sites they host. It’s the hosting provider’s job to maintain the security of servers used in hosting and to implement essential security monitoring features. Shared hosting poses more risks than dedicated or VPS (Virtual Private Server) hosting simply due to the number of sites sharing space on a given server.
security measures must apply to all sites being hosted
post_date: regardless of the platform being used
post_date_gmt: so those measures may not be equally effective for all sites. Dedicated hosting designed for WordPress sites can add more useful security features aimed at WordPress-specific vulnerabilities.

ID: Along with efforts by WordPress itself and responsible web hosting providers
post_author: owners of WordPress sites can also take many steps to tighten security and thwart cyberattacks of all kinds. Below are some WordPress security best practices:

ID: Many cyberattacks on WordPress sites strike smaller ones or those running older versions of WordPress that haven’t received the latest patches and other updates. Owners of these sites might not expect that their sites might be targets
post_author: but they may be even more vulnerable than larger sites containing stores of sensitive data. Installing all of the frequent updates released by WordPress is a key step in keeping a site secure — and that includes updates not only to WordPress itself
post_date: but also to its themes and plugins installed from WordPress and from third-party developers.

ID: WordPress security won’t help if the devices used to manage the site are compromised. Security experts recommend making sure that all computers and mobile devices used for accessing and managing a WordPress site be regularly monitored and updated with effective firewalls and malware scans.

Hackers often attempt to get access to a site by “brute-force attack” — entering usernames and passwords again and again until one works. Because the default username for a WordPress website is “Admin
post_author: ” which is an easy one to guess
post_date: it’s wise to change that to something unique as soon as possible.

ID: Restricting permission to access the site and its directories and disabling file editing can also help
post_author: since WordPress code can easily be edited by anyone who can open it. Likewise
post_date: limit login attempts and set notifications for excessive logins — a sign of login attempts to hack into a site using brute force tactics.

ID: Backing up your WordPress website at least once
post_author: and preferably multiple times
post_date: is always a good idea in case of accidental loss or errors when editing WordPress
post_date_gmt: but it makes good sense from a security standpoint
post_content: too. If a site is compromised with malicious code or viruses
post_title: a clean backup can be restored at any time
post_excerpt: or the site can be moved to a new host if necessary using the backup versions.

ID: New WordPress sites and those that aren’t regularly maintained are prime targets for spam — and that can easily infect a site with malware. Set tight spam filters and keep them updated with the latest version
post_author: monitor commenting carefully
post_date: and block questionable comments from your site’s Admin WordPress dashboard.By its very nature and its massive popularity
post_date_gmt:
WordPress can appear especially vulnerable to hacking and other kinds of cyber attacks for its users. But WordPress sites can be secured on every level from WordPress itself to hosting and site owners themselves — and regular updates and practical steps can keep WordPress sites of all kinds secure.

"
post_content: A Guide to WordPress Security in 2019
Have you noticed that you’re not receiving WordPress contact form notifications? You might be wondering why WPForms isn’t sending you emails when someone fills out your forms
post_title: or why you aren’t seeing any WordPress notifications.

post_author: we’ll walk you through how to fix email delivery issues by sending WordPress emails with Mailgun using WP Mail SMTP.
we recommend using WP Mail SMTP’s Google mailer option in place of Mailgun to avoid technical challenges.

ID: Maybe you’ve noticed that WordPress isn’t sending you email notifications because form entries are piling up in your WordPress dashboard
post_author: or frustrated visitors start to reach out to you using social media or other methods.

ID: The most common reason for missing these emails is due to your WordPress hosting server. Usually it isn’t configured to use the PHP mail() function
post_author: which WordPress uses by default to send emails generated by WordPress or any contact plugin like WPForms.
you can work around this issue by using SMTP.

ID: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is the industry standard for sending emails. Unlike PHP mail function
post_author: SMTP uses proper authentication which increases email deliverability. That’s why we recommend using SMTP to send emails in WordPress.

ID: In this article we’ll show one of the SMTP services we recommend: Mailgun.
Mailgun is a popular email service provider that allows website owners to send large quantities of emails. You can send your first 10
post_author: 000 emails for free every month (or 100 emails per hour)
post_date: though beyond that it’s a paid service. But that’s more than enough for most small websites.

ID: Let’s get started setting up your site to send WordPress emails with Mailgun using WP Mail SMTP.
1. Sign up for a Mailgun account
First you need to sign up for an account on the Mailgun website.

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->

ID: Note: As an added verification step Mailgun will require that you enter credit card information to set up an account
post_author: even if using a free account. For more information
post_date: please see Mailgun’s sign up page.

post_author: you’ll have a couple of additional verification steps to complete. Multiple levels of verification is what allows Mailgun to better ensure email deliverability for all of their users.
you should receive an email to verify your Mailgun account. After clicking the verification link
post_date: you’ll then need to enter a mobile number to receive a text verification code.

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->
you’ll be taken to the login page. Go ahead and log into your new Mailgun account.
you’ll be taken to your Mailgun dashboard. If you didn’t enter credit card details earlier
post_date: you’ll be prompted for that information again here. Otherwise
post_date_gmt: you’ll see a graph that can later show some statistics about the emails you send.

post_author: click on Domains in the main menu.
\"align\":\"center\"} -->
you’ll need to click the Add New Domain button.
\"align\":\"center\"} -->
you’ll need to enter a subdomain of your website’s domain name.

exactly? A subdomain replaces the “www” part of your website’s address; for example: “subdomain.yourwebsite.com.” Subdomains can be used to add separate sections or directories to your website (like how some sites have their blogs on a subdomain such as blog.example.com).
the subdomain we’ll create will be used by Mailgun to send emails.

ID: We’ll create the actual subdomain in the next step. For now
post_author: you can just enter a subdomain such as mail.yourwebsite.com or mg.yourwebsite.com. (It doesn’t really matter what you name it
post_date: but using “mail” or “mg” makes it more clear what its purpose is.)

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->

ID: As we continue into the next step
post_author: be sure to keep this tab or window open as we’ll return to this page later.

ID: As a way of both protecting site owners and their visitors
post_author: some SMTP services like Mailgun require that you verify your domain by adding records to your site’s DNS. You can find more information on the benefits of verifying your domain in Mailgun’s guide.
you’ll need to open your site’s DNS settings. If you’re not sure how to find these
post_date: Mailgun will provide you with some helpful links shown on their setup page when you’re adding a new domain.

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->

ID: Note: If you’re not sure where to find your site’s DNS settings or feel unsure about making changes
post_author: please contact your site’s hosting provider.

ID: Or for more details on modifying a site’s DNS
post_author: we recommend WPBeginner’s tutorial on DNS settings.
you should see an option to add a new record.

ID: To make it possible for Mailgun to verify your domain
post_author: you’ll need to add two TXT records to your site’s DNS. Be sure to copy them carefully
post_date: as you’ll need the exact values from your Mailgun account for the verification to work.

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->

ID: In your site’s DNS settings you may also see a TTL field
post_author: or Time To Live
post_date: field for the record. You can leave this blank to allow the default TTL value to be used.

ID: The next step is to add MX
post_author: or Mail Exchanger
post_date: records.Note: If you are already using MX records to point to an email provider
post_content: modifying MX records can lead to additional email issues.

post_author: be sure to reach out to your site’s hosting provider or Mailgun support.

ID: Mailgun’s MX records are the same for everyone:

post_author: your DNS settings are all set.

ID: Now Mailgun will need to verify that your domain has proper DNS records. This verification can take a while (sometimes 24-48 hours) because DNS records may take some time to update.
You can check the status of your domain verification any time by visiting the Domains page in your Mailgun account. Once Mailgun can verify the DNS changes you made
post_author: it will show active status next to your domain name.
\"align\":\"center\"} -->
you can skip to the next step while you wait for this verification to complete. Just be sure to keep this tab or window open
post_date: as we’ll need it a little later.

ID: Now that you’ve set up your DNS
post_author: you can prepare your WordPress site to start using Mailgun with WP Mail SMTP for sending emails.

ID: The first thing you need to do is install and activate the WP Mail SMTP plugin. For more details
post_author: see our step by step guide on how to install a WordPress plugin.
you need to visit Settings » WP Mail SMTP to configure plugin settings.
you can set the From Email and From Name. By default
post_date: these will fill with your site’s admin email and site name.

post_author: be sure this is set to the same email address used to set up your Mailgun account.

ID: We also recommend that you check the box labeled Force From Email. Since you will need the From Email in all plugins that send email to match this email address (a requirement in order for SMTP to work)
post_author: this option will save you the trouble of editing the email settings throughout your site (in all form emails
post_date: etc).

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->
and you can also choose to Force From Name to apply this setting site-wide. Unlike From Email
post_date: having a specific From Name is not critical to the plugin’s functionality. However
post_date_gmt: it will help email recipients to easily see where these emails are coming from.

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->
in the Mailer field you’ll need to select the Mailgun option.

ID: We also recommend checking the optional Return Path checkbox to Set the return-path to match the From Email. With this enabled
post_author: you’ll be emailed if any messages bounce as a result of issues with the recipient’s email.
\"align\":\"center\"} -->
a new Mailgun section will appear. Here
post_date: you’ll need to enter API and domain information.

ID: Even if your domain is still waiting to be verified
post_author: Mailgun will provide the information you need here. To access this
post_date: you’ll need to return to the tab or window with your Mailgun domain details.

ID: If you look at the bottom the section named Domain Information
post_author: you should see the API Key.
\"align\":\"center\"} -->

ID: Once you’ve copied the text for the full key (including key- at the start)
post_author: return to the WP Mail SMTP settings and paste it into the API Key field.
enter the subdomain you created in Mailgun. If needed
post_date: you can find this at the top of the Mailgun page with your API key.

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->
go ahead and save your settings.
\"align\":\"center\"} -->
make sure that the verification process from Step 3 is complete. This may take a while
post_date: so it’s possible you’ll need to come back to this later.

ID: Once your domain is verified and your settings have been added to WP Mail SMTP
post_author: it’s important to send a test email to ensure that everything is working properly. To do this
post_date: make sure you’re on the Settings » WP Mail SMTP page and open the Email Test tab.

post_author: \"align\":\"center\"} -->
you can enter any email address that you have access to and click the Send Email button.
you should see a success message.
\"align\":\"center\"} -->

ID: If you check the inbox for that email address
post_author: you should receive the email for this test.Note: Be sure to also submit a couple of test submissions for your forms after completing this setup to check that emails deliver successfully.
we recommend setting the From Email in your form’s notification settings to the same email you set up Mailgun with.

ID: That’s it! You have successfully setup your site to send WordPress emails with Mailgun. Now your form notifications will reliably be delivered.

Looking for more email notification tips? You might also want to check out our guide on how to send users confirmation emails from WordPress forms. This is a great way to reassure visitors that their message has been received
post_author: and prevent them from sending duplicates.

ID: Don’t have WPForms yet? What are you waiting for? Get started with the most powerful WordPress forms plugin today.

post_author: How to Send WordPress Emails With Mailgun Using WP Mail SMTP

What is PPC?

PPC stands for pay-per-click
post_title: a model of internet marketing in which advertisers pay a fee each time one of their ads is clicked. Essentially
post_excerpt: it’s a way of buying visits to your site
post_status: rather than attempting to “earn” those visits organically.

ID: Search engine advertising is one of the most popular forms of PPC. It allows advertisers to bid for ad placement in a search engine's sponsored links.
when someone searches on a keyword that is related to their business offering. For example
post_author: if we bid on the keyword “PPC software
post_date: ” our ad might show up in the very top spot on the Google results page.

ID: Google Ads (formerly known as Google AdWords) is the single most popular PPC advertising system in the world.
The Ads platform enables businesses to create ads that appear on Google’s search engine and other Google properties.
Google Ads operates on a pay-per-click model
post_author: in which users bid on keywords and pay for each click on their advertisements.

ID: Every time a search is initiated
post_author: Google digs into the pool of Ads advertisers and chooses a set of winners to appear in the valuable ad space on its search results page.

ID: The “winners” are chosen based on a combination of factors
post_author: including the quality and relevance of their keywords and ad campaigns
post_date: as well as the size of their keyword bids.

post_author: sending a visitor to our website
post_date: we have to pay the search engine a small fee.

post_author: the fee is trivial
post_date: because the visit is worth more than what you pay for it. In other words
post_date_gmt: if we pay $3 for a click
post_content: but the click results in a $300 sale
post_title: then we’ve made a hefty profit.

ID:
• Search Marketing – Identifying and eliminating poor-performing key phrase variants and identification of new high-performing phrases for use in Google Adwords and Bing Ads.
  • Display Advertising and Remarketing - Reaching high value audiences using geographic
post_author: behavioral
post_date: and contextual targeting
post_date_gmt:
as well as recapturing lost visitors using remarketing.
  • Ecommerce and Product Listing Ads (PLA) – Ability to execute seasonal and long term strategies
post_content:
shopping campaigns and comparison shopping campaigns.
  • Social Media Advertising – Ability to target audiences on all major social platforms
post_excerpt:
and more!
  • Conversion Optimization – Extensive usability services spanning heuristic/cognitive analysis
post_password:
and more.
  • Analytics and Attribution Support – Troubleshooting and identifying digital measurement opportunities.

post_author: account audit
post_date:
and development of campaign strategy
  • Targeting using audience segmentation and persona data
post_content: key phrase insights
post_title:
and more
  • Competitive research
  • Account structuring
  • Continuous creative development and testing
  • Location targeting and mobile targeting
  • Bid management
  • Monthly calls and reporting on campaign performancePPC Evaluation

ID: If you have an established PPC presence that is managed in-house and want an expert review of your strategy
post_author: a PPC evaluation from Internet Marketing Ninjas will:

ID:
• Conduct a comprehensive audit of your accounts
  • Conduct competitive research
  • Review and recommend creative ads
  • Review analytics to ensure proper goal and/or ecommerce configuration
  • Provide ready-to-implement actionable recommendations for execution as part of ongoing PPC management.
Pay Per Click Management And Search Engine Optimization
A PPC campaign offers more control over results than organic Search Engine Optimization (SEO).

post_author: you have the ability to compete relatively quickly for phrases that will take much more time to secure using earned media methods such as SEO.

ID: While a new website sometimes takes a lot of time to rank well on search engine result pages (SERPs)
post_author: solid Pay Per Click campaign management can create traffic almost instantly through use of Google Adwords
post_date: Bing Ads and more.

ID: Leveraging Paid Search and SEO together helps create synergy and can create a ‘halo effect’ that improves the performance of both channels.
Social media platforms and new display advertising networks centered around sharable content provide an exciting opportunity to help get the right assets in front of your target audience
post_author: to attract referrals and citations.
if executed with the wrong assets or on the wrong platform
post_date: these campaigns can be very costly with a very low return

ID: . Internet Marketing Ninjas has extensive experience leveraging advertising platforms to support and improve return on content marketing efforts.

We'll Run Your Errands

Have a long to-do list? Let us pick up your dry cleaning, take packages to the post office, pick up prescriptions, or do your shopping.

post_author: https://www.digitalmarketingkenya.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/51-150x150.jpg 150w
post_date: https://www.digitalmarketingkenya.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/51-300x300.jpg 300w

ID: Nairobi Search Engine Optimization (S.E.O) & digital marketing agency.

post_author: it’s building a predictable system to get new customers. Traditionally
post_date: you have two marketing options for growing your business. The first option is to spend money on advertising
post_date_gmt: but that could potentially cheapen your brand with paid ads. You may even attract the wrong customer base. Your second option is to hire an employee
post_content: and you and your team understand how expensive that can be. We believe in a third option: the most powerful salesperson in the world – your website. Did you know that 70% of search engine browsers click on non-paid (organic) listings instead of the ads at the top of the page? DigitalMarketingKenya specializes in creating digital marketing campaigns for small businesses and enterprise businesses that consist of a mix of organic traffic and paid traffic from Google search. DigitalMarketingKenya also assists clients with social media management

ID: YOU SEARCHED FOR \"Nairobi SEO\" AND WE SHOWED UP FIRST
Turn Your Website Into A Full-Time Sales Person Leveraging The #1 Nairobi SEO Agency and find new customers local to you!
building a predictable system to get new customers. Traditionally
post_author: you have two marketing options for growing your business. The first option is to spend money on <a href=\"http://www.google.com\">advertising
post_date: but that could potentially cheapen your brand with paid ads. You may even attract the wrong customer base. Your second option is to hire an employee
post_date_gmt: and you and your team understand how expensive that can be. We believe in a third option: the most powerful salesperson in the world – your website.

ID: Did you know that 70% of search engine browsers click on non-paid (organic) listings instead of the ads at the top of the page?  Digital Marketing Kenya specializes in creating digital marketing campaigns for small businesses and enterprise businesses that consist of organic traffic from Google’s search engine. Digital Marketing Kenya also assists clients with social media management
post_author: PPC advertising
post_date: video production
post_content: and marketing consulting. Read more about our services by clicking here.

ID: If you landed on this page it means that you searched into Google for a Nairobi SEO – you found us because of Google’s search engine. We can do the same thing for your business with your target search phrases by engaging in a competitive search engine optimization campaign.
We are a digital marketing agency offering search engine optimization
post_author: graphic design
post_date: website development
post_date_gmt: and social media marketing services. Our digital agency is cultured in the fact that we are a handpicked search engine marketing team with results that speak for themselves. Managing over 25 monthly clients
post_content: we’re proud to claim that we carry a 90% retention rate with our monthly clients.

ID: Top 6 Reasons Why You Should Hire Digital Marketing Kenya

1. Ranked #1 for “Nairobi SEO” organically in the search
  2. Measurable campaign tracking so you can see where you are
  3. Long tail keyword targeting to avoid competition
  4. Aggressive content marketing strategy for longevity in Google
  5. We never outsource to cheap laborers
Your business gets a custom digital marketing strategy

Our business is in business to grow your traffic and conversions. We use white hat SEO process gives your website a sustainable ranking over time without having to risk raking penalties from Google’s ever-changing algorithm. Digital Marketing Kenya
post_author: practices an SEO approach that leverages your brand for more earned clicks and higher search engine visibility. T

ID: Nairobi is a competitive area for SEO
post_author: and we understand that. Our team starts every search engine campaign by identifying the competitors of our clients. This market research phase allows us to figure out the domain ratings of your competitors to see how much we have to do to beat them. Once we have good competitive data
post_date: we can begin the SEO campaign by following our SEO process:

post_author: we adhere to a technical SEO process where we analyze your website and search for common issues detected that holds back a website’s rankings. These issues include domain redirects
post_date: site security
post_content: site structure
post_status: and much more. Once we have the website in a good technical standing we can continue our SEO process.

ID: The Digital Marketing Kenya team will then add content to your website – content that targets specific keywords that your customers are searching into the Google Search Engine. The content we write on our client’s website tends to be in a longer format to ensure that we get the rankings. In 2019 SEO is all about adding good content to your website that is evergreen to Google’s random algorithm update.
Your content is great to have but you’re going to need to power up the domain rating of your website. First
post_author: by increasing your domain rating all of the golden content that you have written will rank higher in the search engines. In addition adding backlinks to your website will result in a higher search engine ranking. Backlinks can be acquired through our partner networks. Or even by prospecting for links in your local area. Your business can also be featured on several websites where they will place a link back to your website.

ID: How Much Does SEO Cost In Nairobi

post_author: how much does SEO cost in Nairobi? After all
post_date: each and every business is different with their own challenges in the search engines. But for us to determine the price for a business in Nairobi engaging in SEO we must first do a comprehensive competitor analysis.

ID: Our SEO campaigns are for a period of time with one total cost. Your investment is then broken down into monthly payments. For example
post_author: if after competitor analysis we determine that we will need 300 hours to complete service of the campaign and we bill art $100. Furthermore
post_date: you can clearly guess that you’re going to be paying $30
post_date_gmt: 000 for the SEO campaign. This total campaign cost is broken down into monthly payments.

ID: We will be monitoring your SEO campaign and have monthly reporting on your most important KPI metrics. Usually
post_author: for clients
post_date: Our team will monitor things such as:

ID:
• Google analytics data
  • Google my business data
  • Data about Google search console
  • And other webmaster tools that are important to an SEO campaign

post_date: HOME
post_content: inherit

We understand the reasons why you might resist building a website for on of your business: “I’m not tech-savvy”, “they’re too expensive”, “I don’t have the time”, or the infamous “I have enough business and I don’t need one”. The reality is, you don’t need to be tech-savvy, getting a professional website for your business can be cheap and easy, and to make it even simpler for you – not having a website is costing you time and money. Check this out… 81% of people research a business or service on the internet before making a purchase decision. That’s 25.92 million people searching for businesses online. Yet, 46% of business owners listed “Business currently doesn’t need one” as their #1 reason for not having a website. We’re not statisticians
post_title: but we can see that there’s a glaring disconnect here.

ID: Why You Need a Website No Matter Your Industry.
1. Having a website will attract new customers to your business and make you more money.

Your website is your number one marketing asset because we live in a digital age. People spend on average 23.6 hours online per week and are on their mobile devices for up to five hours per day. By now
post_author: consumers expect companies to have an online presence (including a website) and will consider a company that DOESN’T have one as less professional.

ID: We like this stat so much
post_author: we’re mentioning it twice:  81% of people research a business or service online before making a purchase decision. If you don’t have a website
post_date: you have no chance of capturing a share of this market.

ID: Your website can be available 24/7/365 even when you’re not. A website acts as your “always-on” business advocate during and outside of office hours.
Websites help you convert more of your existing referrals because most people still do their research and stack you against your competitors.
2.  Add instant credibility to your business simply by having a website.
The 21st-century consumer is skeptic; in fact
post_author: 56% of people stated that they won’t trust a business without a website. Having a good website instantly boosts your credibility as a legitimate business.
and websites allow you to make a very strong impression with a well-designed introduction for your business.

ID: A website can help showcase your expertise and better position your business. A website can be your number one tool for standing out in a crowd.

post_author: or as expensive
post_date: as you think.

ID: You don’t need to be tech-savvy to get a website. Many web development companies have very simple signup processes which make the process quick and painless for you.
It can be very cost-effective. Websites offer a better return on investment than any other form of advertising. If you’re planning to market your business
post_author: a website should be your priority.

ID: Over time the relatively low investment of getting a business website will pay dividends by driving you new customers and building your brand. <strong><a href=\"https://turbotax.intuit.ca/tax-resources/business-owner-tax/computer-software-deductions-for-business-owners.jsp\">Plus
post_author: it’s a legitimate business expense and a tax write off.

ID: 4.  Having a website will end up saving you time.

post_author: taking calls
post_date: or sending out proposals – communicating with potential customers takes time. Your website can save you that time by providing answers to common customer questions and inquiries. What does this mean for you? You can spend your time doing more valuable things.

ID: 5. Position yourself and stay in control of your brand.
A website acts as a platform for your messaging and shapes the online perception of your business in a way that your social media channels cannot provide.
The platform allows you to position yourself in the market to get the exact type of customers you’re looking for.
Many business owners have been reviewed online
post_author: sometimes unknowingly and/or negatively. How does this affect you? <a href=\"https://www.salesforce.com/ca/blog/2015/03/customer-reviews.html\">79% of users who read online reviews
post_date: believe them. Combat that negativity by posting your positive testimonials.

ID: Avoid 5 common mistakes in Website Design
Flash animation certainly has its place in website design – but it's typically not on the home page of your small business Web design.

Customers arrive at your website expecting to find helpful information about the products and services that interest them – not a slowly unfolding display of digital animation. Use flash wisely – and sparingly – in your professional Web design.
Keeping website design simple can save you – and your customers – from headaches. Use a tried-and-true font style
post_author: such as Arial
post_date: that's sans-serif and proven to be readable.

ID: The background is another area of concern for professional Web design.
Using patterned backgrounds or placing colored type against a black background may cause users to seek someone else's more pleasing website design.
The use of navigation in professional Web design is akin to the use of GPS on a road trip. Use it wisely and visitors will arrive at the desired destination - and even enjoy themselves along the way.
Resist the urge to get too creative with this aspect of your small business Web design – a clean navigation panel is a user's best resource.
When you hide website design navigation in fancy flash animation or images
post_author: your customers will get lost – and lose interest.

ID: When your website design is full of graphics and images
post_author: it requires a greater amount of bandwidth. This increased bandwidth takes longer for the user to download.

ID: In the time it takes for your website design to load
post_author: your customer may very well decide it's not worth the wait.

ID: Try not to forget the people using dial-up or mobile Internet connection. Use the graphics and images that are necessary for your small business Web design and save the rest for your portfolio.

Everyone has come across a small business Web design that seems to include everything but the proverbial kitchen sink. Cluttered website design overwhelms your site's visitors and can make your business appear unprofessional.
A disorganized website design tends to reflect poorly on the very business it is supposed to promote
post_author: while a professional Web design speaks volumes about your attention to detail.

ID: Your website design will become the \"face\" of your business
post_author: so you'll need a professional Web design that not only turns customers' heads but also keeps them interested. Follow the simple guidelines of small business Web design and you'll see the beauty in more positive visitor experience.
DO I NEED A WEBSITE FOR MY SMALL BUSINESS? YES, YOU DO. HERE ARE 5 REASONS WHY.

AMP is an acronym for Linux (Ubuntu), Apache2 HTTP Server, MariaDB or MySQL Database Server and PHP Scripting Language… It is a group of open source software and building block of many of the web applications and majoriy of the content management systems (CMS) in use today…

Content Management Systems like WordPress, Joomla, Drupal and others, they all use the LAMP Stack…

If you’re going to be developing any PHP based applications or websites, then you’re probably going to be using the LAMP Stack as well…

This brief tutorial is going to show students and new users how to install Apache2, MariaDB and PHP on Ubuntu Linux 16.04 / 18.04 and 18.10 servers…

What is WordPress Hosting

As the overall high performance including loading speed

post_title: and is favored by more and more WordPress users.

post_author: some web hosts provide many custom features such as marketplace integration of themes & plugins.

ID: sFTP access to WordPress platforms
post_author: automatic WordPress backup
post_date: WordPress file update versioning

post_author: there are 4 types of WordPress hosting including free
post_date: shared
post_content: dedicated and managed hosting.

ID: In this following chapters
post_author: you will learn the gist of each type to choose the most right solution.

ID: Some companies offer WordPress hosting for free
post_author: which is attractive but seldom good.

ID: We never recommend free WordPress hosting to anyone looking for a real online presence due to numerous drawbacks of this kind of hosting.

post_author: users have to put up with pop-up banners
post_date: ads or frequent shut-downs; users are not allowed to place their own ads
post_content: or to have their own domains for free;

ID: and they’ll eventually be converted into paying customers or just leave their sites. Remember
post_author: there is always a price to pay for something free.

ID: Shared WordPress hosting means many users host their sites on a single server
post_author: which is administered by the hosting provider.

ID: The advantage of shared hosting is its low cost because all users share the total cost of the server.
Shared hosting plans are often claimed to offer unlimited bandwidth and space
post_author: but in fact the resources for each account are limited and unevenly distributed.
such as cPanel and one-click installer
post_date: are available for users to set up and manage their sites easily.

post_author: shared WordPress hosting is a good point for anyone to start their hosting adventure.
it works better with light-traffic websites owned by bloggers or start-up companies because an average plan can handle no more than 300 visits per day.

ID: VPS hosting providers offer dedicated resources to all users by allocating a fixed portion of server resources to each account.
Compared with shared hosting
post_author: it is more expensive as a physical server is shared by less users.

ID: VPS offers more privileges which allow users to run multiple WordPress sites and make more profits.

post_author: the performance of VPS hosting is faster and more stable because of more advanced technologies and better monitoring methods.

ID: VPS can be used to host traffic-extensive WordPress websites such as popular blogs or medium-sized enterprises with thousands of visits per day.
Managing a big WordPress site can be a very complex task
post_author: that’s why managed WordPress hosting exists.

ID: The benefit of managed WordPress hosting is that users don’t need to worry about anything.
It is the provider that deals with all the technical stuffs including server activation
post_author: site backup
post_date: security
post_content: maintenance

post_author: managed hosting is more expensive than the same level of other hosting services.

post_author: starting at $5.49/mo only. They take over all the difficult stuffs that you only need to focus on content and internet business.

Domain name registration is the act of reserving a name on the Internet for a certain period, usually one year. It is important to know that this domain will remain yours for as long as you renew it and there is no way to purchase a domain name forever.

Domain name registration is necessary for a website, an email or another web service. However you don't have to always register a new domain name. Many companies allow you to use subdomains of their domain names for a website, or you can have an email with their primary domain (ex. yahoo.com, gmail.com).

The most important thing about a domain name registration is that it gives you personality and recognized identity. Once you register a domain name, the information about its owner is publicly available.

The price for a domain name registration varies greatly on its extension. For example, the most common .com is the most affordable one, while some country-specific domain name extensions are 5 times more expensive.

What Is Domain Name Backordering

Domain name backordering is a service that allows anyone to reserve a domain name in the event that the name is not yet available to the public. 

If there is a domain name you wish to use, but is currently owned by another party, you can submit a domain name backorder request to the registrar. The registrar will notify you when that domain expires and becomes publicly available again. 

However, this could also work on your domain name, if someone else should have interest in it. 

If you are looking for a domain name backordering service, you should look for a backorder serving that works with a few registrars. The more registrars mean better odds of a successful backorder.

Which TLD should I choose?

TLD, or Top-Level Domain, is the part of the domain name on the right of the dot (\.\"). The most common TLDs are .com

ID:
There are the various types: 
gTLD - generic top level domain

• .com
  • .org - typically for organizations
  • .net
  • .edu - restricted for post-secondary educational establishments
  • .mil - restricted for US military
  • .gov - restricted for US governments and agencies
  • .int - restricted for international organizations established by treaty

• .info - for informational sites
  • .name - for families and individuals
  • .biz - for businesses
  • .mobi - reserved for websites catering to mobile devices
  • .travel - reserved for travel agents
post_author: airlines
post_date: tourism bureaus and hoteliers

ID:
• .ca - for Canada
  • .uk - for the UK
  • .fr - for France
  • Almost every country has a country domain

post_author: decide if you are targeting a local country or if you are planning to go international. ccTLDs are an excellent choice if you need to market your business to a certain geographic region.

ID: There may be many reasons why you want to transfer your domain name registration from one registrar to another: pricing
post_author: domain management and administration
post_date: services
post_content: etc.

ID: All domain name transfer requests must be initiated by the registrant or the Administrative Contact of the domain
post_author: and processed by the gaining registrar
post_date: the registrar whom you are transferring your domain to.

ID: The gaining registrar is required to obtain expressed authorization from the registrant or the Administrative Contact of the domain name. A transfer can only proceed upon the receipt of confirmation of transfer. This confirmation of transfer can be a physical authorization process or an electronic process. Regardless of the process
post_author: the confirmation of transfer needs to be validated with the domain's \"AuthInfo\" code.

ID: The domain \"AuthInfo\" code is a unique code generated on a per-domain basis and is used for authorization or confirmation of a transfer request.
The registrant can obtain the domain's \"AuthInfo\" code from the losing registrar (the registrar whom you are transferring the domain away from).
Before you proceed with a domain name transfer request
post_author: make sure:

ID: <ul><li>The domain has been registered for at least 60 days with your current registrar. If you just recently registered or transferred your domain name
post_author:
you will need to wait 60 days before applying for transfer.
  • The admin contact e-mail is valid
post_date:
as this is where most registrars will send the confirmation of transfer and the domain \"AuthInfo\" code.
  • Domain name is not in protected/locked status.
  • Domain name is not in redemption status.
  • Domain name is not locked for either non-payment or at the owner's request.
  • Domain name is not currently in dispute.
  • Domain name has not been deleted.

ID: Does it matter where I purchase my domain name?
Once you have decided on the domain name you want to use
post_author: your next step is to choose a registrar for your domain name registration.
services offered
post_date: ease of use
post_content: and more.

ID: A registrar is the company that takes your domain name registration information and reserves your domain from the main registry.

post_author: you should keep in mind:

ID: • PriceThe price you pay for your domain can vary greatly between registrars. When comparing prices
post_author: take into account the other services included by the registrar
post_date: their customer support
post_content:
etc.
  • AccreditationYour chosen registrar should be ICANN accredited. ICANN maintains a list of accredited domain registrars. If the domain you have chosen is a reseller of an accredited registrar
post_title:
they should let you know which registrar they represent.
  • TermsTake the time to read and understand your domain registration terms. Pay attention to ownership clause and other terms of condition.
  • DurationDo not register your domain for more than one year in the beginning. That give you time to evaluation your registrar before further commitment
post_status:
allowing you time to evaluate your domain name in case you wish to use a different domain name.
  • DelayA domain name registration generally takes no more than 48 hours.
  • Transfer PolicyYou should be able to transfer your domain to another registrar without any restriction other than those enforced by ICANN. Check the registrar for other restrictions and curbs.
  • Customer SupportCheck if phone
comment_status:
chat or email support is available.
  • ManagementDoes the registrar provide a domain name management panel for you to manage your own domain name? Or do all changes have to go through them?

post_author: Domain Name Registration Process

Moving your WordPress site from one hosting provider can be a long, tedious, annoying process, but what if it didn’t need to be? Many people are faced with the daunting task of host service migration due to problems with their current provider that just have them fed up. The problem is that many people push off migrating, because they’re afraid of losing time or making a mistake that will damage their site. Most people will either hire a professional, find a hosting service that does the migration for them, or just do it themselves to get around the problem.

ID: If you spend a little time preparing your own site
post_author: migrating is nothing to be worried about. It can be a very straightforward process if approached correctly and can easily be backed out of if any problems occur.

ID: Back Up and Transfer Your Website Files
ven if you don’t know what the backup means or its exact contents
post_author: you’ll have it on hand in the event of an unexpected error that makes you wish you could travel back in time.

ID: If you’re using a free migration host
post_author: now’s the time to request a transfer service! A quick Google search for “HostName website transfer request” will guide you to the appropriate form and migration instructions.

ID: You’ll get a confirmation email that says your new host is working on your project
post_author: and it will likely include a contact person to stay in touch with. Stay up to date with the transfer by emailing your contact at the new host.
this guide sums up the steps well:

ID: • Backup your WordPress site files using an FTP program.
• Export your WordPress database within the phpMyAdmin program in your control panel.
• Create a new WordPress database on your new host server.
• Edit the wp-config.php file to reflect the new database name and user info.
• Import your saved database and upload your WordPress files to your new host.

post_author: voila! Your WordPress site has a new home. The final step is to point your WordPress site’s domain name to your new host’s nameservers.

ID: Once your site transfer is complete
post_author: you’ll need to change the DNS of the domain name to point to the new host. To do this
post_date: simply log into the original domain registrar of the WordPress site
post_content: and change the two name servers to those given to you by your new web host.

post_author: if you’re switching your DNS from GoDaddy
post_date: your nameservers might be:

ID: To point your domain to InMotion’s nameservers instead
post_author: you would change them to:
except for that slightly annoying propagation time your domain might experience!

ID: Your website will now live on a new web host
post_author: and you can explore the tools your new host offers. At the same time
post_date: you should click around your site to test any broken links or images. Never underestimate the importance of QA!

ID: B. How to Move Your WordPress Site to a New Domain
Moving a WordPress site to a new domain is actually a bit trickier than moving to a new host. But
post_author: as with most tasks in WordPress
post_date: where there’s a will

ID: Think back to when Mark Zuckerberg decided to change TheFacebook.com to Facebook.com. Unfortunately
post_author: he couldn’t just delete the “the” and call it a day. Changing domain names isn’t as simple as adding or deleting characters. You have to move files and change some database information. Let’s take a look at how to do this.

ID: Note: I strongly recommend pulling up the live chat support to guide you through this process
post_author: because
post_date: depending on the web host
post_date_gmt: there may be additional steps required.

ID: 1B. Purchase a New Domain Name Registration

post_author: create a new domain name in your hosting account. You can browse available domains and purchase the one you want from a third-party registrar
post_date: or you can skip the middleman by selecting a hosting provider that lets you handle your domain registration at signup (often covering the initial year’s registration fees!). Make sure your new domain is pointed to the host that is or will be supporting your WordPress site.

post_author: log into your cPanel file manager and copy the entire set of public_html files from the site you’d like to move.

ID: Head to the new file manager file of your new domain name. Paste the previously copied files there. You’ll now have two copies of the same site in two separate locations. Next
post_author: head to your phpMyAdmin account.

ID: Find the directory labeled “wrdp” associated with your old domain name on the left. If you own and operate several domains
post_author: this can be a bit challenging at first.

ID: Click the plus sign next to your domain to expand options. Click “wp_options
post_author: ” and in the section labeled “siteurl” at the top
post_date: click on the pencil icon to edit. In the middle box
post_date_gmt: change the old URL to your new URL
post_content: then click “Save” or “Go.”

ID: 3B. De-Index URLs of the Old Domain Site
You’ve now moved your WordPress site to a new domain name
post_author: but people can still access your WordPress site at your old domain name. It would be wise to install a plugin
post_date: such as Yoast SEO
post_content: and have search engines de-index any/all URLs of the old site you’d rather people not use or find.

ID: C. How to Move Your WordPress Site to a New Server
If you strictly want to move your WordPress site or blog to a new (upgraded) server
post_author: there’s good news and bad news.

ID: The bad news is that your current server isn’t getting the job done. It’s too slow
post_author: too expensive
post_date: or too cheap. Or perhaps it won’t let you host multiple domains or isn’t equipped with cPanel — or maybe it got hacked by foreign robot spies. That’s a lot of potentially bad news
post_content: hopefully
post_title: it doesn’t all apply to you.

ID: The good news: It’s easy to move a site to a new server. In fact
post_author: most hosts will upgrade servers for you and move everything as well. You’ll simply pay them the difference. Of course
post_date: if you need to migrate to a new host altogether as part of your server migration
post_content: here are the steps to migrate your WordPress site itself:

post_author: back up your site files via the file manager
post_date: and export your site database via phpMyAdmin.

ID: Step 2C: Create a new database on your new host server
post_author: and edit the wp-config file to include the new database name and login credentials. Import your saved database
post_date: and upload your WordPress files.

ID: Step 3C: Ensure your DNS settings are in place
post_author: and conduct a final QA before shutting down your old server or canceling your shared hosting account.

ID: You Can be Moved Into Your WordPress Site’s New Home in an Afternoon

post_author: by using the free resources at your disposal
post_date: you (or your client) can be moved into your WordPress site’s new home in about a day. You don’t need to be a tech expert
post_date_gmt: but do take notes on what your live chat helpers tell you for future migrations. Now
post_content: go impress your clients and have fun in your new hosting environment!

LAMP is an acronym for Linux, Apache2, MariaDB or MySQL and PHP… It’s the building block for majority of the content management systems in use today, like WordPress, Joomla, Drupal and many more…

If you’re going to be developing any PHP based applications or websites with support for Apache2 and MariaDB, then you’re going to probably need the latest version of PHP installed…

With PHP 7.2 released, you can now include the latest PHP version with your stack to improve the performance of the sites and applications… This brief tutorial is going to show students and new users how to install Apache2, MariaDB and PHP 7.2 on Ubuntu Linux 16.04, 17.10 and 18.04 LTS server.

To get started with install LAMP with PHP 7.2 support, follow the steps below:

ID: Step 1: Install Apache2 HTTP Server on Ubuntu
Apache2 HTTP Server represents the A in the LAMP stack… It’s the most popular web server installed today ahead of all the other webservers…
To install Apache2 HTTP on Ubuntu server
post_author: run the commands below…
the commands below can be used to stop
post_date: start and enable Apache2 service to always start up with the server boots.

post_author: open your browser and browse to the server hostname or IP address and you should see Apache2 default test page as shown below.. When you see that
post_date: then Apache2 is working as expected..

ID: MariaDB database server is a great place to start when looking at open source database server… Although MySQL was originally the default database server
post_author: MariaDB has taken over.. To install it run the commands below.
the commands below can be used to stop
post_date: start and enable MariaDB service to always start up when the server boots..

post_author: run the commands below to secure MariaDB server by creating a root password and disallowing remote root access.
answer the questions below by following the guide.

ID:
• Enter current password for root (enter for none): Just press the Enter
  • Set root password? [Y/n]: Y
  • New password: Enter password
  • Re-enter new password: Repeat password
  • Remove anonymous users? [Y/n]: Y
  • Disallow root login remotely? [Y/n]: Y
  • Remove test database and access to it? [Y/n]:  Y
  • Reload privilege tables now? [Y/n]:  Y

post_author: type the commands below to logon to MariaDB server

ID: Then type the password you created above to sign on… if successful
post_author: you should see MariaDB welcome message

ID: PHP 7.2 isn’t available on Ubuntu default repositories… in order to install it
post_author: you will have to get it from third-party repositories.

ID: Run the commands below to add the below third party repository to upgrade to PHP 7.2
Run the commands below to install PHP 7.2 FPM and related modules.
sudo apt install php7.2 libapache2-mod-php7.2 php7.2-common php7.2-mbstring php7.2-xmlrpc php7.2-soap php7.2-gd php7.2-xml php7.2-intl php7.2-mysql php7.2-cli php7.2-zip php7.2-curl

post_author: run the commands below to open PHP-FPM default file.

ID: Then make the changes on the following lines below in the file and save. The value below are great settings to apply in your environments.

post_author: save the file and close out.
there’s nothing to configure.. after install PHP and related modules
post_date: all you have to do is restart Apache2 to reload PHP configurations…

post_author: run the commands below
create a phpinfo.php file in Apache2 root directory by running the commands below

ID: Then type the content below and save the file.
Save the file.. then browse to your server hostname followed by phpinfo.php
You should see PHP default test page…
That’s it! This is how to install LAMP with the latest PHP 7.2 Support on Ubuntu

post_author: \"question\":\"Why does SEO take time before you see the benefits?\"
post_date: \"answer\":\"SEO takes time because there is no longer an easy way to game the system. Search engine algorithms have become more and more advanced with an emphasis on delivering users the most relevant
post_date_gmt: and highest quality results based on their search query. Whereas when SEO began all it took was stuffing a webpage with your chosen keyword and pointing as many links as possible to it to see fast results
post_content: things have changed – drastically. And deploying tactics like this in 2019 are likely to be doing far more harm than good in the long term.\"

it’s building a predictable system to get new customers. Traditionally
post_date:
you have two marketing options for growing your business.

The first option is to spend money on advertising
post_date_gmt: but that could potentially cheapen your brand with paid ads. You may even attract the wrong customer base. Your second option is to hire an employee
post_content:
and you and your team understand how expensive that can be. We believe in a third option: the most powerful salesperson in the world – your website. 

Did you know that 70% of search engine browsers click on non-paid (organic) listings instead of the ads at the top of the page? Digital Marketing Kenya specializes in creating digital marketing campaigns for small businesses and enterprise businesses that consist of a mix of organic traffic and paid traffic from Google search.

Digital Marketing Kenya also assists clients with social media management

ID: How to Create a Popup in Elementor
Pop-up forms help you capture email addresses from leads. Elementor makes creating these forms easier with its pop-up builder. Follow these instructions to create your own popup.

post_author: go to Templates > Popups > Add New.

ID: • Choose a template from the Library or create your own design.

post_author: then Save and Close.

ID: • Open a new page in Elementor (CTRL + E for PC users; Command + E for Mac users).

post_author: choose Link > Dynamic > Actions > Popup.

ID: • Go to Popup > Open Popup and select the popup you created.

post_author: click on the button and see the popup appear.
